../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 2051 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 2141 Obtention of the Node-Address from KN_ or NMH_ frames
The ICAS1 shall obtain the Node-Address from the received KN_ or NMH_ frames as per following:
for CAN or CANFD The Node-Address are the first 10 bits (Byte order: Little-endian) from the "Identifier" for the KN_ and NMH_ frames - PDU-ID KN_ : 0x17F00 / Node-Address / NM_ : 0x1B000 / Node-Address /
for VLAN The Node-Address are the first 10 bits from the (Byte order: Little-endian) from the "Identifier" - started from bit 16th, for the KN_ and NMH_ frames
- PDU-ID KN_ : 0x5 / Node-Address / 0C00 NM_ : 0x02 / Node-Address / 0C00
Example: Instrument Cluster (Kombi in German) Is connected to KCAN (0x12) and Komfort VLAN (0x64)
KCAN: KN_Kombi > Identifier = 0x17F00 014 NMH_Kombi > Identifier = 0x1B00 014
VLAN: KN_Kombi> PDU-ID: 0x50140C00 NM_Kombi> PDU-ID: 0x20140C00
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_8211 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

As long as the Built In List is in State 2, whenever it receives a KN_Frame from ECU "xxx", it shall perform the following: - perform Index Computation with the Frame's Node-Address / Bus-ID, - in the Built-in List, set the parameters of the item at position index as per the result of the Index Computation above, as per the following table
Determination of the Bus-ID parameter for each Built-in List entry based on KN_frames:
KN_frames received via CAN: The Bus-ID depends on the phisical bus where the KN_ frame is received.
KN_frames from ECUs connected on VLAN: Bus-ID Information available in the ethernet KN_frame.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_8212 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_GW_8219
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: pack ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/inc/BuiltInList.h line 126 Requirement is satisfied here: pack ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/inc/BuiltInList.h line 210 Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_IndexComputation ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/src/BuiltInList.c line 807 Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_IndexComputation ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/src/BuiltInList.c line 1222 Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_ComChannelToBusId ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/src/BuiltInList.c line 1259 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 1221 [Hash function]
Whenever the ICAS1 applies the Hash function to a Node-Address "k", it shall perform the following calculation:
- k: Node-Address - K: ICAS1 Node-Address = 0x010h - m: Size of the Built-in Liste (Hash table) = 0x100h - j: Recursion level (For Double Hashing)
H(j,k) ::= ( h1(k) + j*h2(k) ) mod m
h1(k) ::= ( ( m + k - K ) mod m ) h2(k) ::= ((k + 64) mod m/2 ) | 1
Remark: In C language implementation of h2(k) extra pair of brackets should be added to ensure correct operator orders: h2(k) ::= ((k + 64) mod (m/2) ) | 1 ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_8219 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 2474 0x2A26 - Istverbaut
This service reads from the Built-in list the list of Istverbaut parameter
Possible Values: [is built-in] = 1 [is not built-in] = 0
Init Values: 1st entry (ICAS1 and ICAS1_Evo): Value 0x1 Rest of entries: 0x00
In regards to the Istverbaut parameter, the ICAS1 and ICAS1_Evo shall:
- Set the first bit of the Istverbaut always to [is built-in] (position corresponding to the ICAS1 and ICAS1_Evo) - After the generation of Built-In list has been completed, the actual installation is set to [is built-in] by the received node messages. - If the KN_ frame corresponding to a Built-in entry is not received within 700ms +/- 5% then Istverbaut set to [is not built-in].
Remark: Configuration requirements for this identification are part of this document: in chapter 2.18.5.3.2 (Diagnostics ->Identification -> Built-in List -> Configuration) under Object SWR_ICAS1_GW_11480
The Istverbaut parameter has no dependency with the Nachlauftyp. The Istverbaut will be set to [is not built-in] for those ECUs in the Built-in List during KL15 OFF if we don´t receive KN frames for more than 700ms (But for these cases the DTC will not be set, as described in Network Failure Detection chapter).
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_8268 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

This service reads from the Built-in list the list of KD_bit parameter.
Possible Values: [Error] = 1 [no Error] = 0
The ICAS1 shall set the KD_Bit bit of each Built-in list entry as follows:
- Init Values: All positions = [no Error]
- [Error] - If the KD_Bit for a KN_frame is received with [Error], the ICAS1 sets the corresponding KD_Bit in the Built-in List to [Error]
- [no Error] - If the KD_Bit for a KN_frame is received with [no Error], the ICAS1 shall set the corresponding KD_Bit in the Built-in List to [no Error] OR - If the Istverbaut is [is not built-in], the KD_Bit is set to [no Error]
Note: The fist bit of 0x2A28 is the ICAS1 KD_Bit.
Remark: Configuration requirements for this identification are part of this document: in chapter 2.18.5.3.2 (Diagnostics ->Identification -> Built-in List -> Configuration) under Object SWR_ICAS1_GW_11480
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_8270 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

The ICAS1 shall output the signal so_ICAS1_KD_Fehler of KN_Gateway according to the Datenfestlegung with the content - [Error] if at least one bit in 0x2A28 is equal to [Error] > ("OR" operation of all bits in 0x2A28) - [No Error] if all the bits in 0x2A28 are equal to [No Error]
Note: KN_Gateway.ICAS1_KD_Fehler is different from Systeminfo_01.ICAS1_KD_Fehler. Systeminfo_01.ICAS1_KD_Fehler = First bit of 0x2A28

../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 2560 0x2A27 - Sleep-Indication
This service reads from the Built-in list the list of Sleep-Indication parameter.
Possible Values: [ready to sleep] = 1 [not ready to sleep] = 0
The ICAS1 shall set the Sleep-Indication bit of each Built-in list entry as follows:
- Init Values: At the beginning of an Operation-Cycle, the ICAS1 sets the Sleep-indication attribute of the Built-in List to following values: First position (ICAS1) = [not ready to sleep] All other positions = [ready to sleep]
1) GW´s own Sleep-indication bit (First bit in Sleep-Indication)
- [ready to sleep] the ICAS1 sets this Sleep-Indication bit (corresponding to the GW) to [ready to sleep] when all these conditions are fulfilled: - SW-KL 15 Off - Busses are asleep
2) All Sleep-indication bits, except the first one (GW)
- [not ready to sleep] the ICAS1 sets the Sleep-Indication bit in the corresponding Built-in List entry position to [not ready to sleep] when: - the NMH_Frame for a Built-in List entry was received the last 500ms +/- 5%, the ICAS1. (For any value of Nachlauftyp) - If Nachlauftyp = 0x0, the Sleep-Indication is [not ready to sleep] while KL15 ON and the last KN_ frame was received during the last 700ms +/- 5%
- [ready to sleep] the ICAS1 sets the Sleep-Indication bit in the corresponding Built-in List entry position to [ready to sleep] when: - The conditions to set the bit to [not ready to sleep] are not fulfilled
Remark: Configuration requirements for this identification are part of this document: in chapter 2.18.5.3.2 (Diagnostics ->Identification -> Built-in List -> Configuration) under Object SWR_ICAS1_GW_11480
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_8272 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

This service reads from the Built-in list the list of DiagPath parameter.
Possible Values: [not diagnosticable] = 1 [diagnosticable] = 0
- Init Values: At the beginning of an Operation-Cycle, the ICAS1 sets the DiagPfad attribute of the Built-in List to following values: First position (ICAS1) = [diagnosticable] All other positions = [not diagnosticable]
The ICAS1 shall set the DiagPath bit of each Built-in list entry as follows: - First position (ICAS1) always to [diagnosticable] - [not diagnosticable] IF the signal "Diagpfad" of the corresponding KN_ frame is received with the value [not diagnosticable]
- [diagnosticable] if the signal "Diagpfad" of the corresponding KN_ frame is received with the value [diagnosticable]

The Sollverbau defines the nodes which shall be present in the system configuration. This information is used to make the comparation between the components whics should be present in the system configuration, and the elements which are currently present, and detect errors
Sollverbau list shall be readable and writeable by means of DID 0x04A3 This DID is used to code which ECUs will be installed in the vehicle
Possible Values: [SHOULD_NOT_BE_BUILT_IN] = 0 [SHOULD_BE_BUILT_IN] = 1
Init Values: Before Sollverbau will be written First position (ICAS1) = [SHOULD_BE_BUILT_IN] All other positions = [SHOULD_NOT_BE_BUILT_IN]
Note: Unoccupied/undefined/reserved list positions have the value '0'. The service shall know the position of each system in the table. Solverbau is stored in NV-RAM.
Remark: Configuration requirements for this identification are part of this document: in chapter 2.18.5.3.2 (Diagnostics ->Identification -> Built-in List -> Configuration) under Object SWR_ICAS1_GW_11480
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_8277 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_Write_0x04A3 ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/inc/BuiltInList.h line 1512 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 3088 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 3121 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 3183 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 3219 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 3267 When the ICAS1 and ICAS1_Evo receives a request to write the Sollverbau RDID 2E 04 A3 where the first position in (ICAS1 and ICAS1_Evo) is set to [SHOULD_NOT_BE_BUILT_IN] (this would define the ICAS1 and ICAS1_Evo as not built in).
then, the ICAS1 and ICAS1_Evo shall ignore the request and, depending on the addressing type: - In case of physical addressing, the ICAS1 and ICAS1_Evo responds with NRC 0x31 - In case of functional addressing, the ICAS1 and ICAS1_Evo does not send any response.

../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 4514 0x2A29 - DiagProt Gateway Component List DiagProt
This service reads from the Built-in list the list of DiagProt parameter for all nodes
Init Values: 1st entry (ICAS1): Value 0x11 > ISO-TP + IP Rest of entries: 0x00
After Built-In List generation: IF [Occupied entries] NodeAddress != 0x00 AND BUSID != 0x00 -> DiagProt = 0x11 ELSE [Not Occupied entries] -> DiagProt = 0x00
After reception of KN: Based on DiagPfad: IF DiagPfad == 0 -> 0x11 ELSE 0x00
Remark: Configuration requirements for this identification are part of this document: in chapter 2.18.5.3.2 (Diagnostics ->Identification -> Built-in List -> Configuration) under Object SWR_ICAS1_GW_11480
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_8290 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_GW_10331
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_VerifyUDSRequestState ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/inc/BuiltInList.h line 1462 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 3620 If CRoute receives a parallel request from a higher priority protocol then CRoute shall immediately abort the processing of the first request (having the lower prio). CRoute shall in this case re-initialise the timing in the UDS protocol stack.
If necessary further procedures need to be considered (e.g. NVM Handler activities, Statemachine Inits). Pending NVM write requests (triggered by the lower priority protocol) shall be completed (if removing them from the queue is no more possible), but no response shall be provided.
Aborting a request must not cause a reset of CRoute.
Details after discussion with VW T. Koch/P. Hofmann 06.03.2019: - "immediately abort the processing of the first request (having the lower prio)." is related to the processing of a request. - In no case a response shall be provided to the lower prio request, but the higher prio response shall be provided - an ongoing reception of the lower prio request is handeled by ISO-TP and will not be aborted - an ongoing transmission of the lower prio response might be aborted or completed (whatever the ISO-TP stack supports)
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_10331 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: #TBD# ASIL: QM

Dynamic Content Liste shall be readable via 0x22 ReadDataByIdentifier 0x0502. 0x0502 shall return "Dynamic part" of the ContentList which contains 16 elelments of 3 Bytes each: - Bus ID (1 Byte) - Node ID (2 Bytes)
Dynamic part of Content Liste shall be writeable via 0x2E WriteDataByIdentifier 0x0502. 0x0502 shall require data payload equal 96 bytes.
Remark: More information on configuration details and buffer layout of adaptation 0x0502 can be found in SWR_ICAS1_GW_11193
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_10917 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

VLANs). (Bus interface coded in 1Byte)
Remark: The Bus-ID 0x00 is used for undefined Bus-IDs. This allows to "reserve" a position for the node in the Built-in List list, without the need to define explicitly in which bus it will be connected. For these nodes, the Bus-ID will be defined in the Built-in Liste during run-time, taking this information from the KN_ Frames or NMH_ Frames.

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_GW_11751
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_ReportDTC0x300000 ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/src/BuiltInList.c line 532 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 3528 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 3571 The ICAS1 shall report DTC 0x300000 during list position calculation - as Qualified when no free list position can be assigned to a node
Remark: Problem of enabling/disabling DTC 300000 from different reasons is known and accepted as sporadic by VW: DTC 300 000 can be set when: - no free position on Built-In List - Node is not coded but it's Istverbauit is set. It means that in scenario: activation condition A -> Activation condition B -> Deactivation cond. A DTC will be deactivated, BUT Activation condition B will be still valid. Accepted by Mr Erik Hahn from VW site. (link to clarification from Mr Erik Hahn in VW-Jira added)
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_11751 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_GW_11998
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_RebuildBIL ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/src/BuiltInList.c line 449 Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_SetBILExtDefaultValues ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/src/BuiltInList.c line 1173 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 777 Step 1 - Reset the Built in List
If at least one of following conditions is met: - system startup, - update of the Content List by DID 0x0502 than Built-In List shall perform following actions: - reset KN and NM timeout timers, - reset all parameters to the init values, except sollverbau, - reset all currently set Timeout DTC's
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_11998 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_GW_11999
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_RebuildBIL ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/src/BuiltInList.c line 450 Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_ProcessContentList ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/src/BuiltInList.c line 492 Requirement is satisfied here: BIL_ComChannelToBusId ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/src/BuiltInList.c line 1260 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 778 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 836 Requirement is verified here: TEST ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/ECU_DIAG_Chorus/BUILTINLIST/c/test/swut/BuiltInList.c.test line 875 Step 2 - Index calculation
Perform index calculation for each Built-in List node address NOT equal to 0, sequentially: - the static part is hashed first, - the dynamic part is hashed after (all elements introduced using write request of DID 0x0502),
Built-in List shall ensure protection of data modification during every update or reset process. - update state (prevent parameters modifcation) is set during stete 1 and state 2, or any internal operations on BIL are performed. - normal state (allowing parameters modification) is set after step 2 of Built-in List is finished, or internal operations on BIL are finished
Remark: phrase 'Internal operatons' used here means: modification of Built-in List parameters performed by Built-in List component.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_GW_11999 _ObjectType: Requirement SPR: not_SPR_reviewed ASIL: QM
